questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 1. Based on their response to a magnetic field, there are three types of magnetic materials, namely ferromagnetic, paramagnetic, and diamagnetic. The material that is strongly attracted to magnets and can become a magnet, namely ….

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 2. The following material considered paramagnetic is ….

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 3. These are some correct ways to make a magnet, except ….

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 4. If the north pole of a magnet is brought close to the north pole of another magnet, what will happen?
options: a. they cancel each other out
d. they rotate to face south

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 5. Look at the picture. The correct direction of the following magnetic field lines is ….

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 6. Look at the picture. The image above shows 3 bar magnets. If C is the north pole, B and C repel each other, D and E attract each other, then the types of poles at A and F are ….
options: a. A the north pole and F the south pole
b. A the south pole and F the north pole
c. A and F are the north poles
d. A and F are the south poles

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 7. Look at the picture. Based on the image above, the poles of magnet A and B are ….
options: a. A the north pole and B is the south pole
b. A is the south pole and B is the north pole
c. A and B are the north poles
d. A dan B are the south poles

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 8. A compass needle points North because it is attracted to the ….
options: a. the Earth's magnetic south pole
d. the geographic north pole exactly

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 9. A wire 50 cm long is in a magnetic field of 20 T. If the current flowing is 5 A, then the Lorentz force is ….

10. Pay attention to the following image. Based on the image, determine the value of the primary current is ….

(Vp = 100 V, Vs = 50 V, Is = 0,4 A)

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 11. A step down transformator is connected to a voltage of 6000 volts. If the resulting electric current is 5 A and the electrical power in the secondary coil is 27.000 watt, determine the efficiency of the transformer….

questions.subject: Science
questions.question:
12. Pay attention to the following table. The types of transformer P and Q are ….

Transformer P: Primary voltage 110V, Secondary voltage 200V
Transformer Q: Primary voltage 220V, Secondary voltage 110V
options: a. transformer P is step up and transformer Q is step down
b. transformer Q is step up and transformer P is step down
c. transformer P and transformer Q are step up
d. transformer P and transformer Q are step down

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 13. The following events that are not chemical reactions are...

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 14. What is the main difference between a physical change and a chemical change?
options: d. formation of a new substance

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 15. What is an example of a chemical change?

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 16. What is meant by a chemical reaction?
options: a. change in the form of a substance
b. change in the properties of a substance
c. change in a substance that cannot be reversed
d. change in the color of a substance

questions.subject: Science
questions.question:
17. Pay attention to the following question.

In the reaction equation 2H₂ + O₂ → 2H₂O, the product is...
a. H₂
b. O₂
c. H₂O
d. H₂ and O₂

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 18. What is the general form of a decomposition reaction?

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 19. The general formula for a synthesis reaction is shown by ….

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 20. What happens in a chemical decomposition reaction?
options: a. a substance is broken down into new, more complex substances
b. a substance is broken down into new, simpler substances
c. a substance undergoes a color change
d. a substance reacts to form a complex compound

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 21. What is meant by a reactant in a chemical reaction?
options: a. a substance produced after the reaction
b. a substance used before the reaction
c. a substance that is irreversible
d. a substance that can return to its original form

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 22. Which of the following is always involved in a combustion reaction?

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 23. What happens in a combination or synthesis reaction?
options: a. A substance decomposes into simpler substances
b. Simple substances combine to form a new product
d. The substance evaporates into a gas

questions.subject: Science
questions.question:
24. What is the balanced chemical equation for the reaction between sodium and chlorine gas?

a. 2Na (s) + Cl₂ (g) → NaCl (s)
b. Na (s) + Cl₂ (g) → NaCl (s)
c. Na (s) + 2Cl₂ (g) → NaCl (s)
d. 2Na (s) + Cl₂ (g) → 2NaCl (s)

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 25. What is meant by corrosive in the context of chemistry?

questions.subject: Science
questions.question:
26. The following is the method to save physical magnets (keeping strength) are ….

Choose ALL correct answers.

questions.subject: Science
questions.question:
27. If a bar magnet is cut into 2, the pieces will have the following properties, among other …

Choose ALL correct answers.
options: a. only has a south pole
c. has a north pole and a south pole
d. only has a north pole

questions.subject: Science
questions.question:
28. The properties of magnets are….

Choose ALL correct answers.
options: a. has a north pole and a south pole
b. can attract certain object, like iron
c. like poles attract each other
d. not has a magnetic field

questions.subject: Science
questions.question:
29. The following materials considered diamagnetic are ….

Choose ALL correct answers.

questions.subject: Science
questions.question:
30. The correct statement about ferromagnetic material are ….

Choose ALL correct answers.
options: c. an example of the object is wood

questions.subject: Science
questions.question:
31. The correct example of physical and chemical changes is ….

Choose ALL correct answers.
options: a. water freezing into ice is a chemical change
b. rusting iron is a chemical change
c. burning wood produces a new substance
d. cutting paper is a chemical reaction

questions.subject: Science
questions.question:
32. The correct example of chemical reactions in daily life is ….

Choose ALL correct answers.
options: a. water heated until it boils is a chemical reaction
b. ice melting to form a new substance
c. photosynthesis produces a new substance in the form of glucose
d. spoiled milk is the result of a chemical reaction

questions.subject: Science
questions.question:
33. Types of Chemical Reactions are ….

Choose ALL correct answers.
options: a. decomposition reactions produce only one type of substance
b. combustion reactions always involve oxygen
c. synthesis reactions are the combination of several substances into a new substance
d. the change of water into steam is considered a decomposition reaction

questions.subject: Science
questions.question:
34. Examples of Reaction Energy & Experimental Evidence are ….

Choose ALL correct answers.
options: a. the formation of a precipitate indicates that no chemical reaction has occurred
b. a solution that changes color only undergoes a physical change
c. an exothermic reaction is characterized by a rise in the surrounding temperature because heat is released
d. energy changes in chemical reactions occur due to the breaking and forming of chemical bonds

questions.subject: Science
questions.question:
35. Law of Conservation of Mass & Reaction Balancing is ….

Choose ALL correct answers.
options: a. in a chemical reaction in a closed system, the total mass of substances before and after the reaction remains constant
b. if the coefficients are increased, then the total mass of substances after the reaction becomes greater than before the reaction
c. reaction coefficients can be changed, but the chemical formulas of the substances must not be altered when balancing
d. balancing a reaction is done by changing the subscripts (small numbers) in the chemical formulas

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 39. Mention 4 characteristics of a chemical reaction!

questions.subject: Science
questions.question: 40. Ben and Cam are conducting a physics experiment in the laboratory. Ben measures the current passing through an electronic component with a resistance of 25 Ohm. The component is given a voltage of 5 volts. It turns out that the measured electric current is the same as the electric current passing through Cam's current-carrying wire. If the current-carrying wire is 2 m long and is in a 4 T magnetic field, determine the magnitude of the resulting Lorentz force!
